item.title: Report E-2025020021
item.description:
Report E-2025020021

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-01
  • City: BISCOE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver connected the Consignee's hose that leads into the storage tank. He noticed the hose gasket did not look good and replaced the gasket. There were no issues initially with the unload. The driver the unload area unattended to use the restroom. Upon returning to the trailer, the hose was leaking at the location of the replaced gasket. 200 gallons of product released. The Release impacted an area of 5’X50’ on concrete and asphalt. No soil or drains were impacted. Area was pressure-washed and the water was collected for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025011285
item.description:
Report X-2025011285

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH THE BOTTOM WET. RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE TO FIND CAP OFF OF CONTAINER BUT STILL IN THE BOX. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND TERURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.
